intro: Searsia tumulicola f. pumila, commonly known as the dwarf yellowwood, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, dense growth habit. The plant features small, elliptical leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. It produces yellowish-green flowers in clusters, followed by small, round fruits. This species is well adapted to rocky and arid environments, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant plant.
